summary: App that takes a user's explanation, analyzes their thinking pattern, detects specific misconceptions/mental-model breakdowns, and returns targeted insights explaining why the model failed.
known_issues: Current app behavior does not yet reliably analyze user explanations to identify misconceptions and explain mental-model breakdowns as intended.

existing_features.title: Ensure the frontend analysis flow reliably uses the backend result when the backend method exists, and only shows the fallback disclosure prefix (`[Using fallback analyzer]`) when the fallback analyzer was actually used (not when backend succeeds).

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement core flow: user enters explanation → system analyzes thinking pattern → returns insights about specific misconception and why the mental model broke down

Update the backend `analyzeExplanation` method (`backend/main.mo`) so it no longer returns fixed placeholder strings and instead produces a result derived from the caller-provided explanation text, returning exactly two fields: `misconception` and `whyFailed`, where `whyFailed` explains why the user’s mental model broke down.

projectName: Make analysis reflect arbitrary user explanations (misconception + mental-model breakdown)
